org.projecthaystack

Class HProj

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.projecthaystack.HProj
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HClient, HServer

    public abstract class HProj
extends Object
    HProj is the common interface for HClient and HServer to provide access to a database tagged entity records.
    See Also:
    Project Haystack

    • Method Detail

      • about

        public abstract HDict about()
        Get the summary "about" information.

      • readById

        public final HDict readById(HRef id)
        Convenience for "readById(id, true)"

      • readById

        public final HDict readById(HRef id,
                            boolean checked)
        Call "read" to lookup an entity record by it's unique identifier. If not found then return null or throw an UnknownRecException based on checked.

      • readByIds

        public final HGrid readByIds(HRef[] ids)
        Convenience for "readByIds(ids, true)"

      • readByIds

        public final HGrid readByIds(HRef[] ids,
                             boolean checked)
        Read a list of entity records by their unique identifier. Return a grid where each row of the grid maps to the respective id array (indexes line up). If checked is true and any one of the ids cannot be resolved then raise UnknownRecException for first id not resolved. If checked is false, then each id not found has a row where every cell is null.

      • onReadById

        protected abstract HDict onReadById(HRef id)
        Subclass hook for readById, return null if not found.

      • onReadByIds

        protected abstract HGrid onReadByIds(HRef[] ids)
        Subclass hook for readByIds, return rows with nulls cells for each id not found.

      • read

        public final HDict read(String filter)
        Convenience for "read(filter, true)".

      • read

        public final HDict read(String filter,
                        boolean checked)
        Query one entity record that matches the given filter. If there is more than one record, then it is undefined which one is returned. If there are no matches than return null or raise UnknownRecException based on checked flag.

      • readAll

        public final HGrid readAll(String filter)
        Convenience for "readAll(filter, max)".

      • readAll

        public final HGrid readAll(String filter,
                           int limit)
        Call "read" to query every entity record that matches given filter. Clip number of results by "limit" parameter.

      • onReadAll

        protected abstract HGrid onReadAll(String filter,
                                   int limit)
        Subclass hook for read and readAll.

      • watchOpen

        public abstract HWatch watchOpen(String dis,
                                 HNum lease)
        Create a new watch with an empty subscriber list. The dis string is a debug string to keep track of who created the watch. Pass the desired lease time or null to use default.

      • watches

        public abstract HWatch[] watches()
        List the open watches.

      • watch

        public final HWatch watch(String id)
        Convenience for "watch(id, true)"

      • watch

        public abstract HWatch watch(String id,
                             boolean checked)
        Lookup a watch by its unique identifier. If not found then raise UnknownWatchErr or return null based on checked flag.

      • hisRead

        public abstract HGrid hisRead(HRef id,
                              Object range)
        Read history time-series data for given record and time range. The items returned are exclusive of start time and inclusive of end time. Raise exception if id does not map to a record with the required tags "his" or "tz". The range may be either a String or a HDateTimeRange. If HTimeDateRange is passed then must match the timezone configured on the history record. Otherwise if a String is passed, it is resolved relative to the history record's timezone.

      • hisWrite

        public abstract void hisWrite(HRef id,
                              HHisItem[] items)
        Write a set of history time-series data to the given point record. The record must already be defined and must be properly tagged as a historized point. The timestamp timezone must exactly match the point's configured "tz" tag. If duplicate or out-of-order items are inserted then they must be gracefully merged.
